intro: Triumfetta oenpelliensis, commonly known as the Oenpelli glorybower, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers that appear in late summer. The plant has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners in suitable climates.
